page.title: 04Jeremiah James Colman
page.content: The Â£Mustard King' bought Cliffe House, in Corton in 1869. He spent many thousands of pounds on the house, and then turned his attention to sea defences. He built a sea wall and promenade in 1897. At about the same time he provided Corton with its Village Hall and United Methodist Chapel, and he was the main contributor to the fund for building a School. He built many of the houses in Corton for his staff. You can still see J.J.C. inscribed on the brickwork. Cliffe House was eventually demolished in 1917, but the gardens were sold and became one of Cortons first holiday attractions. The gardens are now covered with undergrowth.
